remarks: This lemma proves that q_n is in the subalgebra, as in the proof of Lemma 1 in [BrosowskiDeutsh] p. 90.  Q is used to represent q_n in the paper, N is used to represent n in the paper, and M is used to represent k^n in the paper.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
stoweidlem40.1 $e |- F/_ t P $.
stoweidlem40.2 $e |- F/ t ph $.
stoweidlem40.3 $e |- Q = ( t e. T |-> ( ( 1 - ( ( P ` t ) ^ N ) ) ^ M ) ) $.
stoweidlem40.4 $e |- F = ( t e. T |-> ( 1 - ( ( P ` t ) ^ N ) ) ) $.
stoweidlem40.5 $e |- G = ( t e. T |-> 1 ) $.
stoweidlem40.6 $e |- H = ( t e. T |-> ( ( P ` t ) ^ N ) ) $.
stoweidlem40.7 $e |- ( ph -> P e. A ) $.
stoweidlem40.8 $e |- ( ph -> P : T --> RR ) $.
stoweidlem40.9 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A ) -> f : T --> RR ) $.
stoweidlem40.10 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A /\ g e. A ) -> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) + ( g ` t ) ) ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem40.11 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A /\ g e. A ) -> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) x. ( g ` t ) ) ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem40.12 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. RR ) -> ( t e. T |-> x ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem40.13 $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN ) $.
stoweidlem40.14 $e |- ( ph -> M e. NN ) $.
stoweidlem40 $p |- ( ph -> Q e. A ) $.

$d T t x $.
$d f g ph $.
$d ph x $.
